page.title: 19The Witches' Rock
page.content: On a large rock at St.Clement a long time ago a group of witches met together and sang enchanting songs. Many fishermen had to pass this rock on the way home. To do so safely, they had to pay the witches the thirteenth fish of their catch. Once, a fisherman whose thirteenth fish was a starfish was asked for his tribute. The fisherman quickly cut one of the rays off the starfish and threw it on to the rocks. It landed in the form of a cross. Then he cried out,"La Crouee est mon passeport!" Since then the witches have been neither seen nor heard.
